boat.name: Theta
boat.full_description: Theta was built in 1982 to a hull design by Percy Dalton ** based closely on the lines of the Falmouth Quay Punts of the late19th/early20th century.Little is known of her early years when she was based on the East Coast.In 1997 she was bought by Steve Morris and moved to Guernseywhere he carried out an extensive rebuild of the deck,coachroof and interior to a very high standard.In 2005 ownership changed to John Harvey and home port Weymouth.During his ownership she made a brief appearance in the film "The Boat that Rocked" and a new engine was fitted for the 2010 season.John Crellin bought her in 2013and she moved to Salcombe.Since then she has cruised extensively on the Devon and Cornish coasts,the Channel Islands and the north and west coasts of Brittany visiting manyclassic boat gatherings including Brest,Douarnenez and Paimpol in France and Brixham,Falmouth,Plymouth and Dartmouth in UK.With increasing knowledge of the boat and some fine tuning she has proved to be a very successful competitor in classic racing and easy to sail as a single hander.
boat.construction_details: GRP hull,Teak over ply deck,Mahogany coachroof and coamings.
